items.name: service
items.description: The details of the services provided by organizations to a range of different groups.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the service. Each service must have a unique identifier.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization that provides this service.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The official or public name of the service.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the service.
description.example: Counselling Services provided by trained professionals. Suitable for people with mental health conditions such as anxiety, depression, or eating disorders as well as people experiencing difficult life events and circumstances.

email.name: email
email.title: Email
email.description: An email address which can be used to contact the service provider.

status.name: status
status.title: Status
status.description: The current status of the service which can be active, inactive, defunct, or temporarily closed.

fees.name: fees
fees.title: Fees
fees.description: DEPRECATED: Details of any charges for service users to access this service.

accreditations.name: accreditations
accreditations.title: Accreditations
accreditations.description: A free text description of any accreditations. Accreditation is the formal evaluation of an organization or program against best practice standards set by an accrediting organization.
accreditations.example: All of our practitioners are accredited by the BASC, UKCP, and the Professional Standards Body

minimum_age.name: minimum_age
minimum_age.title: Minimum Age
minimum_age.description: The minimum age of a person required to meet this eligibility requirement.

maximum_age.name: maximum_age
maximum_age.title: Maximum Age
maximum_age.description: The maximum age of a person required to meet this eligibility requirement.

assured_date.name: assured_date
assured_date.title: Assured Date
assured_date.description: The date that the information about the service was last checked.

assurer_email.name: assurer_email
assurer_email.title: Assurer Email
assurer_email.description: The contact e-mail address for the person or organization which last assured the service.

alert.name: alert
alert.title: Alert
alert.description: A description of any short term alerts concerning the service.
alert.example: Following COVID-19 we have moved most of our counselling sessions online. Please contact the reception if you require further information.

last_modified.name: last_modified
last_modified.title: Last Modified
last_modified.description: The datetime when the service, or any related information about the service, has changed. Should have millisecond accuracy.

schedules.name: schedules
schedules.title: Schedules
schedules.description: The details of when a service or location is open. Entries are RFC 5545 RRULES.

items.name: schedule
items.description: The details of when a service or location is open. Entries are RFC 5545 RRULES.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the schedule. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is the regular schedule

service_at_location_id.name: service_at_location_id
service_at_location_id.title: Service At Location Identifier
service_at_location_id.description: The identifier of the ‘service at location’ table entry, when this schedule is specific to a service in a particular location.

valid_from.name: valid_from
valid_from.title: Valid From
valid_from.description: The date from which the schedule information is valid. It must be in the ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DD,

valid_to.name: valid_to
valid_to.title: Valid To
valid_to.description: The last date on which the schedule information is valid. It must be in the ISO 8601 format of YYYY-MM-DD.

dtstart.name: dtstart
dtstart.title: Date Start
dtstart.description: iCal - The date of the first event is the schedule. Necessary when using the ‘interval’ feature, optional otherwise.

freq.name: freq
freq.title: Frequency
freq.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats.

interval.name: interval
interval.title: Interval
interval.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. For example, and Interval of 2 for a WEEKLY Frequency would represent fortnightly.

byday.name: byday
byday.title: By Day
byday.description: iCal - Comma separated days of the week. Where freq is MONTHLY each part can be preceded by a positive or negative integer to represent which occurrence in a month; e.g. 2MO is the second Monday in a month. -1FR is the last Friday

bymonthday.name: bymonthday
bymonthday.title: By Month Day
bymonthday.description: iCal - Comma separated numeric days of the month, where frequency is MONTHLY. Can be negative to represent days before the end of the month; e.g. -5 is the 5th to last day in a month.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the availability of the service.
description.example: The service is available from 10 am to 6pm weekdays. The service is not available on public holidays.

opens_at.name: opens_at
opens_at.title: Opens At
opens_at.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.)

closes_at.name: closes_at
closes_at.title: Closes At
closes_at.description: The time when a service or location closes. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix ‘Z’ when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am EST.).

schedule_link.name: schedule_link
schedule_link.title: Schedule Link
schedule_link.description: URL of a link for the schedule which may show each individual session and may provide a booking facility.

attending_type.name: attending_type
attending_type.title: Attending Type
attending_type.description: A free text description of how to attend this service.
attending_type.example: You can attend this service in-person or remotely via video conferencing

notes.name: notes
notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Free text notes on the schedule.
notes.example: Some of our staff will be unavailable during their lunch break which may be any 30 minute period between 1200 and 1400

service_areas.name: service_areas
service_areas.title: Service Areas
service_areas.description: The details of the geographic area for which a service is available.

items.name: service_area
items.description: The details of the geographic area for which a service is available.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the service area. Each service area must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this entry describes the service area

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: A free text geographic area where a service is available.
name.example: The service is available to all residents of the MyCity area. We provide the service in our offices or via video conferencing to any who can provide evidence of their residency.

extent.name: extent
extent.title: Extent
extent.description: A definition of the polygon defining the area.

extent_type.name: extent_type
extent_type.title: Extent Type
extent_type.description: The format of the extent field  populated from an enum of  "geojson", "topojson",  "kml",and (for legacy systems or early state during transformation) "text".

uri.name: uri
uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI which acts as a persistent identifier to identify an area.

service_area.name: service_area
service_area.title: Service Area
service_area.description: A free text geographic area where a service is available.
service_area.example: The service is available to all residents of the MyCity area. We provide the service in our offices or via video conferencing to any who can provide evidence of their residency.

service_at_locations.name: service_at_locations
service_at_locations.title: Service At Locations
service_at_locations.description: A link between a service and a specific location.

items.name: service_at_location
items.description: A link between a service and a specific location.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the service at location entry. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service at a given location.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location where this service operates.

location.name: location
location.description: The details of the locations where organizations operate. Locations may be virtual, and one organization may have many locations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the location. Each location must have a unique identifier.

location_type.name: location_type
location_type.title: Location Type
location_type.description: The type of location, which may be either physical, postal, or virtual.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the location.
description.example: MyCity Civic Center is located on Main Street and contains facilities for a number of civic and community services available.

latitude.name: latitude
latitude.title: Latitude
latitude.description: The latitude of the location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

longitude.name: longitude
longitude.title: Longitude
longitude.description: The longitude of the location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

external_identifier.name: external_identifier
external_identifier.title: External Identifier
external_identifier.description: A third party identifier for the location, which can be drawn from other services e.g. UK UPRN.

external_identifier_type.name: external_identifier_type
external_identifier_type.title: External Identifier Type
external_identifier_type.description: The scheme used for the location's external_identifier e.g. UK UPRN.

addresses.name: addresses
addresses.title: Addresses
addresses.description: The addresses of locations where organizations operate.

items.name: address
items.description: The addresses table contains the physical addresses for locations

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the postal address. Each postal address must have a unique identifier.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for this postal address.

attention.name: attention
attention.title: Attention
attention.description: The name of the person or entity whose attention should be sought at the location. These are often included as a "care of" component of an address.

address_1.name: address_1
address_1.title: Address line 1
address_1.description: The first line(s) of the address, including office, building number and street.

city.name: city
city.title: City
city.description: The city in which the address is located.

region.name: region
region.title: Region
region.description: The region in which the address is located (optional).

state_province.name: state_province
state_province.title: State Or Province
state_province.description: The state or province in which the address is located.

postal_code.name: postal_code
postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal code for the address.

country.name: country
country.title: Country
country.description: The country in which the address is located. This should be given as an ISO 3361-1 country code (two letter abbreviation).

address_type.name: address_type
address_type.title: Address Type
address_type.description: The type of address which may be physical, postal, or virtual.

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

items.name: attribute
items.description: The other_attributes table creates a link between entities other than service and one or more classifications that describe the entity.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the attribute entry. Each attribute entry should have a unique identifier.

link_id.name: link_id
link_id.title: Link Identifier
link_id.description: The identifier of the entity to which this taxonomy term applies.

taxonomy_term_id.name: taxonomy_term_id
taxonomy_term_id.title: Taxonomy Term Identifier
taxonomy_term_id.description: The identifier of this taxonomy term from the taxonomy table.

link_type.name: link_type
link_type.title: Link Type
link_type.description: A code taken from an enumerated open codelist to indicate what the taxonomy term describes, e.g. the service eligibility or intended audience.

taxonomy_term.name: taxonomy_term
taxonomy_term.description: Each service can be categorized according to one or more taxonomy terms. The taxonomy_term object contains a list of taxonomy terms, their names, and, for hierarchical taxonomies, their structure.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this taxonomy term. Each taxonomy term must have a unique identifier, within the scope of the dataset.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the term.

parent_id.name: parent_id
parent_id.title: Parent Identifier
parent_id.description: If this is a child term in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this is not required.

taxonomy.name: taxonomy
taxonomy.title: Taxonomy
taxonomy.description: If this is an established taxonomy, a free text description of which taxonomy is in use. If possible, provide a URI.

taxonomy_id.name: taxonomy_id
taxonomy_id.title: Taxonomy Identifier
taxonomy_id.description: The identifier of the taxonomy containing the term.

taxonomy_term.title: Taxonomy Term

accessibility.name: accessibility
accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: The details of the arrangements for access to locations for people who have disabilities

items.name: accessibility
items.description: The details of the arrangements for access to locations for people who have disabilities.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this accessibility information. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier for the location of the accessibility provision.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the assistance or infrastructure that facilitates access to clients with disabilities.
description.example: The building is equipped with induction loops for hearing aids. Wheelchair access is possible on all levels.

details.name: details
details.title: Details
details.description: Any further details relating to the relevant accessibility arrangements at this location.
details.example: Switch hearing aid to T-coil to access the induction loop facility.

url.name: url
url.title: URL
url.description: The URL of a page giving more information about the accessibility of the location.

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

items.name: attribute
items.description: The other_attributes table creates a link between entities other than service and one or more classifications that describe the entity.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the attribute entry. Each attribute entry should have a unique identifier.

link_id.name: link_id
link_id.title: Link Identifier
link_id.description: The identifier of the entity to which this taxonomy term applies.

taxonomy_term_id.title: Taxonomy Term Identifier
taxonomy_term_id.description: The identifier of this taxonomy term from the taxonomy table.

link_type.name: link_type
link_type.title: Link Type
link_type.description: A code taken from an enumerated open codelist to indicate what the taxonomy term describes, e.g. the service eligibility or intended audience.

taxonomy_term.name: taxonomy_term
taxonomy_term.description: Each service can be categorized according to one or more taxonomy terms. The taxonomy_term object contains a list of taxonomy terms, their names, and, for hierarchical taxonomies, their structure.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this taxonomy term. Each taxonomy term must have a unique identifier, within the scope of the dataset.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the term.

parent_id.name: parent_id
parent_id.title: Parent Identifier
parent_id.description: If this is a child term in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this is not required.

taxonomy.name: taxonomy
taxonomy.title: Taxonomy
taxonomy.description: If this is an established taxonomy, a free text description of which taxonomy is in use. If possible, provide a URI.

taxonomy_id.name: taxonomy_id
taxonomy_id.title: Taxonomy Identifier
taxonomy_id.description: The identifier of the taxonomy containing the term.

taxonomy_term.title: Taxonomy Term

accessibility.name: accessibility
accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: Description of assistance or infrastructure that facilitate access to clients with disabilities.
accessibility.example: The building is equipped with induction loops for hearing aids. Wheelchair access is possible on all levels.

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

items.name: attribute
items.description: The other_attributes table creates a link between entities other than service and one or more classifications that describe the entity.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the attribute entry. Each attribute entry should have a unique identifier.

link_id.name: link_id
link_id.title: Link Identifier
link_id.description: The identifier of the entity to which this taxonomy term applies.

taxonomy_term_id.name: taxonomy_term_id
taxonomy_term_id.title: Taxonomy Term Identifier
taxonomy_term_id.description: The identifier of this taxonomy term from the taxonomy table.

link_type.name: link_type
link_type.title: Link Type
link_type.description: A code taken from an enumerated open codelist to indicate what the taxonomy term describes, e.g. the service eligibility or intended audience.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this taxonomy term. Each taxonomy term must have a unique identifier, within the scope of the dataset.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the term.

parent_id.name: parent_id
parent_id.title: Parent Identifier
parent_id.description: If this is a child term in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this is not required.

taxonomy.description: If this is an established taxonomy, a free text description of which taxonomy is in use. If possible, provide a URI.

location.title: Location

languages.name: languages
languages.title: Languages
languages.description: The details of the languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

items.name: language
items.description: The languages that are spoken at locations or services. This does not include languages which can only be used with interpretation.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the language. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which the entry describes the languages in which services are delivered.

phone_id.name: phone_id
phone_id.title: Phone Identifier
phone_id.description: The identifier of the phone for which the entry describes the languages in which services delivered.

organization.name: organization
organization.description: The details about each organization delivering services. Each service should be linked to the organization responsible for its delivery. One organization may deliver many services.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the organization. Each organization must have a unique identifier.

name.name: name
name.title: Name
name.description: The official or public name of the organization.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description containing a brief summary about the organization. It can contain markup such as HTML or Markdown.
description.example: Example Org is a non-profit organization dedicated to providing services to qualified beneficiaries

email.name: email
email.title: Email
email.description: The contact e-mail address for the organization.

website.name: website
website.title: Website
website.description: The URL (website address) of the organization.

logo.name: logo
logo.title: Logo
logo.description: A URL to an image associated with the organization which can be presented alongside its name.

uri.name: uri
uri.title: URI
uri.description: A persistent identifier to uniquely identify the organization such as those provided by Open Corporates or some other relevant URI provider. This is not for listing the website of the organization: that can be done through the website field of the Organization.

parent_organization_id.name: parent_organization_id
parent_organization_id.title: Parent Organization Identifier
parent_organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization's parent organization.

organization_identifiers.name: organization_identifiers
organization_identifiers.title: Organization Identifiers
organization_identifiers.description: The details of the third party identifiers for organizations, such as: company registration number, charity number, tax registration number.

items.name: organization_identifier
items.description: The details of the third party identifiers for organizations, such as: company registration number, charity number, tax registration number.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this organization identifier entry. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

organization_id.name: organization_id
organization_id.title: Organization Identifier
organization_id.description: The identifier of the organization. This should match the uuid of an organization object.

identifier_scheme.name: identifier_scheme
identifier_scheme.title: Identifier Scheme
identifier_scheme.description: The scheme of the third party identifier, according to http://org-id.guide/.

identifier_type.name: identifier_type
identifier_type.title: Identifier Type
identifier_type.description: A human-readable equivalent of the identifier_scheme. This may be used in cases where org-id.guide does not list an appropriate identifier scheme.

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

items.name: attribute
items.description: The other_attributes table creates a link between entities other than service and one or more classifications that describe the entity.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the attribute entry. Each attribute entry should have a unique identifier.

link_id.name: link_id
link_id.title: Link Identifier
link_id.description: The identifier of the entity to which this taxonomy term applies.

taxonomy_term_id.name: taxonomy_term_id
taxonomy_term_id.title: Taxonomy Term Identifier
taxonomy_term_id.description: The identifier of this taxonomy term from the taxonomy table.

link_type.title: Link Type
link_type.description: A code taken from an enumerated open codelist to indicate what the taxonomy term describes, e.g. the service eligibility or intended audience.

taxonomy_term.description: Each service can be categorized according to one or more taxonomy terms. The taxonomy_term object contains a list of taxonomy terms, their names, and, for hierarchical taxonomies, their structure.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this taxonomy term. Each taxonomy term must have a unique identifier, within the scope of the dataset.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the term.

parent_id.name: parent_id
parent_id.title: Parent Identifier
parent_id.description: If this is a child term in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this is not required.

taxonomy.title: Taxonomy
taxonomy.description: If this is an established taxonomy, a free text description of which taxonomy is in use. If possible, provide a URI.

taxonomy_id.title: Taxonomy Identifier
taxonomy_id.description: The identifier of the taxonomy containing the term.

description.description: A free text description of the term.

parent_id.description: If this is a child term in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this is not required.

organization.title: Organization

funding.name: funding
funding.title: Funding
funding.description: The sources of funding for a service or organization.

items.name: funding
items.description: The sources of funding for a service or organization.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the funding. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service in receipt of this funding.

source.name: source
source.title: Source
source.description: A free text description of the source of funds for this organization or service.
source.example: This service is funded partially by the MyCity local government and via grants made by charity funding bodies. We also operate a for-profit department which is used to partially cover the expense of the public service

cost_options.name: cost_options
cost_options.title: Cost Options
cost_options.description: The costs of a service at certain points in time. This is an LGA Extension table. This table provides a structured version of the text information contained in the 'fees' field of the 'service' table.

items.name: cost_option
items.description: The costs of a service at certain points in time. This is an LGA Extension. This object provides a structured version of the text information contained in the 'fees' field of the 'service' object.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the cost option. Each entry must have a unique identifier

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the services for which the entry describes the cost.

valid_from.name: valid_from
valid_from.title: Valid From
valid_from.description: The date when this price is valid from.

valid_to.name: valid_to
valid_to.title: Valid To
valid_to.description: The date when this price is valid to.

option.name: option
option.title: Option
option.description: Conditions associated with the cost option.

amount.name: amount
amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The cost of the option, expressed as an amount.

amount_description.name: amount_description
amount_description.title: Amount Description
amount_description.description: Specific details qualifying the cost amount.

contacts.name: contacts
contacts.title: Contacts
contacts.description: The details of the named contacts for services and organizations.

items.name: contact
items.description: The details of the named contacts for services and organizations.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for the contact. Each contact must have a unique identifier.

service_id.name: service_id
service_id.title: Service Identifier
service_id.description: The identifier of the service for which this is a contact.

title.name: title
title.title: Title
title.description: The job title of the contact.

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: A link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

items.name: attribute
items.description: The other_attributes table creates a link between entities other than service and one or more classifications that describe the entity.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier of the attribute entry. Each attribute entry should have a unique identifier.

link_id.name: link_id
link_id.title: Link Identifier
link_id.description: The identifier of the entity to which this taxonomy term applies.

taxonomy_term_id.name: taxonomy_term_id
taxonomy_term_id.title: Taxonomy Term Identifier
taxonomy_term_id.description: The identifier of this taxonomy term from the taxonomy table.

link_type.name: link_type
link_type.title: Link Type
link_type.description: A code taken from an enumerated open codelist to indicate what the taxonomy term describes, e.g. the service eligibility or intended audience.

taxonomy_term.name: taxonomy_term
taxonomy_term.description: Each service can be categorized according to one or more taxonomy terms. The taxonomy_term object contains a list of taxonomy terms, their names, and, for hierarchical taxonomies, their structure.

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this taxonomy term. Each taxonomy term must have a unique identifier, within the scope of the dataset.

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: A free text description of the term.

parent_id.name: parent_id
parent_id.title: Parent Identifier
parent_id.description: If this is a child term in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this is not required.

taxonomy.name: taxonomy
taxonomy.title: Taxonomy
taxonomy.description: If this is an established taxonomy, a free text description of which taxonomy is in use. If possible, provide a URI.

taxonomy_id.name: taxonomy_id
taxonomy_id.title: Taxonomy Identifier
taxonomy_id.description: The identifier of the taxonomy containing the term.

taxonomy_term.title: Taxonomy Term
